name: dipstikk
text: A comment left by dipstikk was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jyri00555, dasilodavi, Zem)

name: agika
text: Hey, that might help ME get over MY fear of Charlie Chaplin!  Thanks, Achewood!

name: stubob
text: It's weird, two nights ago my friend told me how he was afraid of Charlie Chaplin.  I guess an impersonator approached him as a child in Vegas and freaked him the fuck out when he was a child. Maybe this also happened to Ray?

name: fuzzyshoo
text: Or maybe.. just maybe.. it's Cartilage Head.

name: deimosrising
text: Hmmm...that Chaplin bears a suspicious resemblence to some figure from Ray's past...

name: sargasm
text: Absolutely.  But where does the violin fit in?

name: chaesar
text: Maybe Ray was too damaged to remember it was a saw.

name: afterward
text: Seriously, why is Ray afraid of violins/a violin? Téodor does not bother asking.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Violin strings were once made of cat gut.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: only cat gut wasn't really cat gut, they just called it that, I didn't check it on wiki to find this out, I don't know where I know this from, but anyway http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catgut . However Ray probably does not know this . . .

name: scifigrl47
text: Could it not be the cursed fiddle that caused him to sing death metal lyrics and pass out?

name: scifigrl47
text: And that was a banjo.  thus proving I should reread the archives before making brilliant leaps of logic that just later prove to be moronic.

name: stoicromance
text: A comment left by stoicromance was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, riotdejaneiro, Vondicus, EM2, envika, 7th_shot, salo, decagon, StagnantDisplay, BionicSheep, Spenham, gussiejives, NDCaesar, Conn, Fermatprime, atticusonline, JonMW, LordPretzel, JesseDaniel, fattypneumonia, luckypyjamas, aHatOfPig, ravindra108, gardenhead_, FinnS, erinye, smilebuddha, scraggg, clintisiceman, echidnaboy, Panserbjorne, Rakadin, projectiles, Appers)

name: sje46
text: I'm digging the chubby/lame ration here.

name: zem
text: rations: meager

name: mystkmanat
text: You have died of cholera.

name: connormc
text: What an impossibly handsome snag.  A chubby for you.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Man I hope I never get mail from the diabetes results center. You don't even want to open that.

name: gormster
text: Actually diabetes takes about five minutes to test for. I do not have it as of my last trip to my GP.

name: gus
text:
The last time I had blood work done, I got a message on my answering machine that I "needed" to call the clinic. I freaked: I "needed" to call? It was probably diabetes. No, it was my liver, the booze was finally doing me in. Or maybe it was my prostate. I was going to have to have major junk surgery.

I had to call them about five times before I got hold of my doctor's nurse, and then she had trouble finding my file. I'm on hold listening to muzak thinking my file has already been forwarded to the surgeon who is going to hack on me. Finally she finds it and tells me my test results were good. I "needed" to call to hear that?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: apparently so, if you were in such a state.

name: smoothjimmyapollo
text: What makes it great is "Postmaster: Find this man ."

name: sabacc
text: What the hell is in Danville?

name: sje46
text:
Huh?
It's a small town in New Hampshire.
Where did someone mention a Danville?

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
oh, so now you think you're Clever Dan.

Fry 'em up, Dan!

listen up, Jor-DAN...

LIMOZEEN IS COMING TO DANAPOLIS!!

//end

name: sje46
text:
*hug*
I know. It's tough. It's tough.

name: 1000hz
text:
5 for the last panel.

Man, I seriously fear diabetes like that too. ALL my grandparents have it.

name: flavius
text: You know Charlie Chaplin entered a Charlie Chaplin look alike contest and got 2nd place?

name: straw
text: Also Hitler grew his stache like that because he was a bigtime Chaplin fanboy.

name: pwb
text: A comment left by pwb was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, NeoNaoNeo, godfatherofsouls, Panserbjorne, motts, spicyponyhead)

name: connellingus
text: Nah, Chaplin wore that mustache as "the Tramp" in films two decades before Hitler rose to power.

name: presterjohn
text: Although Chaplin did make use of the similarity in 'The Great Dictator,' his first talking film. (Excellent flick.)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: They were born 3 days apart. If only Chaplin had agreed to Hitler's request to be a stunt double in his early films.....

name: jonmw
text: Nah, he cut it smaller because it needed to fit under a gasmask.

name: tagrineth
text: Third, actually.

name: kledermans
text: Why does Téodor have claws?  Isn't he a teddy bear?

name: professorhazard
text:
I have wondered this many a time, myself.

Then again, he also has genitals. Tiny, tiny genitals.

name: thegreatestcape
text:
These two factors, not to mention the ability for face-removal, make the Teodor model one of the worst-selling around.

It has scarred more children than I care to mention. Also I do not have the requisite figures to back up my claim.

name: terribleman
text: Where does it say that Teodor is a stuffed toy? He's a bear. Granted, he's no bigger than a cat, but a bear none the less. In my mind.

name: soticoto
text:
... You've not been here very long, have you?
Go back and read the archives.

name: terribleman
text: I have, actually. But my perceptions are all garbled from reading the back story in the books. I know that he is based on Onstad's stuffed bear, like several other characters. You have to admit it's all very blurry.

name: kilroywashere
text: Man, has it really been more than a year since the last DIABEETUS reference?

name: reverendsam
text: RAY IS SO AFRAID OF DIABETES

name: falseprophet
text: U.p.:Up.

name: beansdooma
text:
Alt text is a winner.

"The drawing you didn't see is him making a bad first impression on George Clooney"

name: tragicone
text: That would be horrible. It is a back of the mind frightfulness.

name: dwodles
text: A comment left by dwodles was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, atticusonline, Zem)

name: zem
text: agreed

name: snowman
text: relative newcomer here, but in the past week i have gone through the entire archive up to this point (all read while at work).  this is probably not my favorite strip ever, but it is the one that made me finally sign up and comment, because i actually think i might try this therapy.

name: epicurus
text: Let me know if it works. I'm sick to hell of memorizing losing lottery tickets.

name: epicurus
text:
Can't you just hear the eerie voice saying "Ch-haaaaaaa-plin-nnnnnn..."?

Because I sure can!

name: breadcrab
text: Totally. Like the sound a ghost would make when mocking you.

name: epicurus
text: Can you really put a stamp on an envelop that reads "POSTMASTER: FIND THIS MAN"? Is there an extra charge for "P:FTM" delivery?

name: tekende
text: Postmaster: Find This Man delivery can only be ordered by the President of the United States. It is very special.

name: epicurus
text: And only if the president can prove beyond reasonable doubt that diabetes is involved.

name: luckypyjamas
text: i wonder if somewhere there is a drawing of a letter that isn't folded into perfect thirds ?

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: I owe the world a damn favor.
Philippe: FUN PARTY! Everyone's invited!
Lyle: hwna fk'd that happne a WEEK?!
Little Nephew: they Chinezed my azz!

Ray's therapy is not working.

name: eca
text: Shelling out on a therapist only to have them make you memorise random numbers and shit is the saddest thing.

name: zem
text: noice av
